item.title: Sam Altman Is Out at OpenAI; Mira Murati Will Be Interim CEO
item.description: The CEO was ousted amid safety concerns tied to rapid expansion of commercial offerings, sources say.

item.title: Apple and Disney Among Companies Stopping Ads on X
item.description: The move follows other major advertisers that have stepped back from the platform after Elon Musk posted that an antisemitic social-media post was ‘the actual truth.’

item.title: Meditation Can Reveal a Sacred Reality
item.description: Paying close attention to the world and our own minds can help us see that much of what we experience as real is actually our projection.

item.title: How JFK's Secrets Fed Conspiracy Culture
item.description: The contrast between the president’s idealistic public image and his own clandestine methods helped make his assassination an emblem of distrust in government.

item.title: Israel-Hamas War Puts Palestinians Back on Arab World's Agenda
item.description: Israel’s fierce response to Hamas’s cross-border assault has reinvigorated support for Palestinians in the Arab world and stirred popular anger—not just at Israel and the U.S., but also at Arab governments.

item.title: Israel, Ukraine, China: Foreign Challenges Hinder Biden's Re-Election Bid
item.description: Two wars are straining the president’s ability to focus on persuading voters ahead of 2024.

item.title: Jim Chanos is shutting down hedge funds he manages that wager against companies he believes are overpriced or fraudulent.
item.description: Jim Chanos is shutting down hedge funds he manages that wager against companies he believes are overpriced or fraudulent.

item.title: OpenAI pushed out co-founder Sam Altman as CEO, saying he wasn't being "consistently candid in his communications" with the company's board.
item.description: OpenAI pushed out co-founder Sam Altman as CEO, saying he wasn’t being “consistently candid in his communications” with the company‘s board.

item.title: TikTok is facing what it views as perhaps its biggest crisis yet, with the app facing an intense backlash over the perception it favors pro-Palestinian and, at times, antisemitic content.
item.description: TikTok is facing what it views as perhaps its biggest crisis yet, with the app facing an intense backlash over the perception it favors pro-Palestinian and, at times, antisemitic content.

item.title: The Republican head of the House Ethics Committee filed a resolution to expel Rep. George Santos, putting a possible vote within weeks after the panel released a scathing report finding the lawmaker stole money from his campaign.
item.description: The Republican head of the House Ethics Committee filed a resolution to expel Rep. George Santos, putting a possible vote within weeks after the panel released a scathing report finding the lawmaker stole money from his campaign.

item.title: The U.S. Treasury market is in the midst of major supply and demand changes, as foreigners no longer have an insatiable appetite for U.S. government debt.
item.description: The U.S. Treasury market is in the midst of major supply and demand changes, as foreigners no longer have an insatiable appetite for U.S. government debt.

item.title: The S&P 500 and Nasdaq each rose 0.1% while the Dow was little changed.
item.description: The S&P 500 and Nasdaq each rose 0.1% while the Dow was little changed.

item.title: The Texas State Board of Education voted to block science lessons published by eight companies from appearing on a statewide list of textbook providers, citing problems with the way they depicted climate change and evolution.
item.description: The Texas State Board of Education voted to block science lessons published by eight companies from appearing on a statewide list of textbook providers, citing problems with the way they depicted climate change and evolution.

item.title: European governments are boosting their assistance to Ukraine as worries grow that Washington's failure to approve new aid could cause Ukraine to lose ground in the war against Russia.
item.description: European governments are boosting their assistance to Ukraine as worries grow that Washington’s failure to approve new aid could cause Ukraine to lose ground in the war against Russia.

item.title: House Speaker Mike Johnson starting making public video footage from the Jan. 6, 2021, attack on the U.S. Capitol, while Democrats blasted Republicans over the release.
item.description: House Speaker Mike Johnson starting making public video footage from the Jan. 6, 2021, attack on the U.S. Capitol, while Democrats blasted Republicans over the release.

item.title: The war between Israel and Hamas is entering a new phase, as the Israeli military takes its fight underground and into Gaza's legendary subterranean tunnel network.
item.description: The war between Israel and Hamas is entering a new phase, as the Israeli military takes its fight underground and into Gaza’s legendary subterranean tunnel network.

item.title: Israel said it would allow limited fuel deliveries to the enclave after supplies ran out and plunged the strip into a communications blackout.
item.description: Israel said it would allow limited fuel deliveries to the enclave after supplies ran out and plunged the strip into a communications blackout.

item.title: The UAW has secured worker backing for new labor contracts at Ford and Stellantis.
item.description: The UAW has secured worker backing for new labor contracts at Ford and Stellantis.

item.title: FDIC Chairman Martin Gruenberg took responsibility and apologized for the agency's workplace culture in a video to staff.
item.description: FDIC Chairman Martin Gruenberg took responsibility and apologized for the agency’s workplace culture in a video to staff.

item.title: Apple, Disney and other major companies stopped advertising on X after Musk described an antisemitic post as "the actual truth" and lashed out again at the ADL.
